text: __NOTOC__ Aethlius (Ancient Greek: ) of Samos was the author of a work titled Samian Annals (),Horoi were chronicles describing the foundation of Ionian cities. the fifth book of which is quoted by Athenaeus, although he expresses a doubt about the genuineness of the work.Athenaeus, xiv. p. 650, d. 653, f Aethlius is also referred to by Clement of Alexandria and Clement of Alexandria, Protrepticus p. 30, a Eustathius,Eustathius, ad Od. vii. 120, p. 1573 and in the Etymologicum Magnum.Etymologicum Magnum, s.v. , where the name is written "Athlius" His dates are uncertain, but it is probable he lived some time in the 5th or 4th century BC.Fowler 2 (oxford, 2013), p. 619; Brills's New Jacoby 536 ==Recent editions== * Fowler R.L., Early Greek Mythography. 1 (Oxford, 2000), 29 s. and Early Greek Mythography.
